intro: Thymus praecox var. ciliatus, commonly known as the creeping thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southern Europe. It features small, fragrant flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in early spring. The plant has aromatic, narrow leaves that are often used in culinary and medicinal applications. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its hardy nature and ornamental value make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a resilient, decorative plant.
